text:
Q: A command to display a a key's randomart image from a fingerprint? A:

Using process substitution, you can also do:

ssh-keygen -lvf <(cat /etc/ssh/ssh_host_ed25519_key.pub)
                    # ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
                    # |- or your desired public key

or, in modern versions of ssh-keygen (i think):

cat /etc/ssh/ssh_host_ed25519_key.pub | ssh-keygen -lvf -
#   ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^                   ^
#   |- or your desired public key                       |- this indicates stdin

Q: 32x32 icons for rich text editor? A:

You should look into the Tango Icon Library, it looks great and it's into the public domain (as noted in their FAQ).

The have the same icons in 16x16, 32x32 and 64x64 but they also gave you the svg source, so, you can easily get any dimensions you want exporting them with Inkscape

You can also use the LGPL Crystal Clear as recommended by cobbal.

Q: How to extract contours for each stacked bag (web sling) in a depth image using OpenCV? A:

@fmw42 Changing contrast and IlluminationFlattening are common tasks in ImageProcessing., so you could use it from libraries of different technologies, or implement it in your favourite language. My actual code is in c#, if you want to see some c#-code, I will post it here, just tell me.

Q: Terminology for a value that has a particular type in Haskell A:

Thanks @NaïmCamilleFavier and @ShahbazHassan. I didn't know about these uses of "term" and "inhabitant" (and hadn't though of "expression").

So at this point it looks like there is no way use the grammatical construction "<x> is an <R> of <T>" for Haskell (or other languages that use instance in a similar way to express a typeclass/type sort of relationship).

(I would propose the "token"/"type" phrasing, but I have no influence on the relevant communities!)

Q: Remove ListView items in Android A:

ridiculous :)

Ended up recreating whole "spinner" control inside other spinner "itemselected" ...

My kotlin code looks now as christmas tree :)
